content: Three things: Ali Mese Blocked Unblock Follow Following Mar 1, 2014 Submit to The Startup: If you are here to get your stories published in The Startup, scroll down to the “Submissions” section & submit your story. From 0 to 1 Million Visitors: We’ve moved our online marketing course link to /course . Apply for Storyteller/Content Writer position: If you pursue a writing career, see the following section below to apply for our writer position. Apply for Storyteller/Content Writer job position Who we are: We are Growth Supply , a storytelling studio that grows startups through words. We work with some of the world’s leading startups from Silicon Valley to Asia. Our clients include Google, Hubspot, Neil Patel, Ahrefs, Shopify, Kissmetrics, Drift, JotForm, Freshdesk. We do content only. No design. No single line of code. We focus on words. We chase stories. We manage everything content from writing blogs, website copy, onboarding emails and newsletters to 280-character tweets so our clients can focus on building a product their customers will love. Job description: Stories. They move people. And moving people is a powerful way to move our clients’ businesses. An increasing number of today’s top startups turn to us to get help with building a sustainable growth engine. These startups are often frustrated because they have wasted time and resources trying to buy their audiences’ attention through ads or other inorganic marketing channels. That’s where you come in. We are looking for content writers who believe in the power of storytelling and understand how growth starts with “words”: from writing articles that conquer the front page of the internet to crafting copy that converts. What to expect: We are a 9-person (and a growing) team. You will work directly with me . You can work from anywhere. Our team works remotely across London, Singapore, New York, Canada, Bali, Amsterdam, and Thailand. Though we don’t have a pile of cash sitting in our bank account, we know the true cost of quality content and we will do our best to match your rates. We value quality over quantity. You won’t be required to deliver a certain amount of content and we’ll go at your own pace following whatever frequency you think is best for you to deliver quality work. You will work with some of today’s top startups — we think hearing the names of our clients will get you excited. We also own The Startup , Medium’s largest entrepreneurship publication followed by + 425,102 people. Your work will be exposed to them, too. You will have a chance to cross-publish your work in leading publishers (i.e., our syndication partners) from The Next Web to Entrepreneur.com. How to apply: Please send over your CV, samples of your previous writing work along with whatever you think qualifies you for this role. If you do not hear from us within a week, please consider your application not accepted. Feel free to reach out to me directly via the email address you can find at the bottom of /about Submissions section: Submit your Medium story to The Startup in two easy steps: 1. Please fill out the form below: 2. And have a peek at our guidelines: Topics we’re interested in The future of technology and blockchain: Artificial Intelligence, cryptocurrencies, ICO, ethereum, VR/AR/MR, IoT, robotics, data science, machine learning, big data. Web development and design: UX, UI, design, developing, programming, apps, software, hardware, SaaS. Startup culture: Investing, entrepreneurship, VC, fundraising, angel investors, innovation, marketing, social media, leadership and management. What to avoid Stock photography: instead of using cheap stock images, try giving your story some love by picking a beautiful, free picture from Unsplash . Listicles and clickbait headlines: e.g “These 5 things will make you insanely successful”. Already-published stories: Medium’s algorithm favours ‘fresh’ stories. This means it will list articles by the date they were originally published — not in the order we accept them. In the interest of getting your story as much visibility as possible, please submit unpublished drafts only :) **We reserve the right to edit photographs and copy where necessary** Thank you in advance! Ali
title_html: Three things:
html:
Homepage
Homepage
Sign inGet started
  • Top 5 Stories Today
  • This Month
  • All-time
  • ⌨️Submit
  • Get smarter at building startups

Three things:

Ali Mese
Mar 1, 2014
  1. Submit to The Startup: If you are here to get your stories published in The Startup, scroll down to the “Submissions” section & submit your story.
  2. From 0 to 1 Million Visitors: We’ve moved our online marketing course link to https://growthsupply.com/course.
  3. Apply for Storyteller/Content Writer position: If you pursue a writing career, see the following section below to apply for our writer position.

Apply for Storyteller/Content Writer job position

Who we are:

  • We are Growth Supply, a storytelling studio that grows startups through words.
  • We work with some of the world’s leading startups from Silicon Valley to Asia. Our clients include Google, Hubspot, Neil Patel, Ahrefs, Shopify, Kissmetrics, Drift, JotForm, Freshdesk.
  • We do content only. No design. No single line of code. We focus on words. We chase stories. We manage everything content from writing blogs, website copy, onboarding emails and newsletters to 280-character tweets so our clients can focus on building a product their customers will love.

Job description:

Stories. They move people. And moving people is a powerful way to move our clients’ businesses. An increasing number of today’s top startups turn to us to get help with building a sustainable growth engine.

These startups are often frustrated because they have wasted time and resources trying to buy their audiences’ attention through ads or other inorganic marketing channels.

That’s where you come in.

We are looking for content writers who believe in the power of storytelling and understand how growth starts with “words”: from writing articles that conquer the front page of the internet to crafting copy that converts.

What to expect:

  • We are a 9-person (and a growing) team. You will work directly with me.
  • You can work from anywhere. Our team works remotely across London, Singapore, New York, Canada, Bali, Amsterdam, and Thailand.
  • Though we don’t have a pile of cash sitting in our bank account, we know the true cost of quality content and we will do our best to match your rates.
  • We value quality over quantity. You won’t be required to deliver a certain amount of content and we’ll go at your own pace following whatever frequency you think is best for you to deliver quality work.
  • You will work with some of today’s top startups — we think hearing the names of our clients will get you excited.
  • We also own The Startup, Medium’s largest entrepreneurship publication followed by + 425,102 people. Your work will be exposed to them, too.
  • You will have a chance to cross-publish your work in leading publishers (i.e., our syndication partners) from The Next Web to Entrepreneur.com.

How to apply:

Please send over your CV, samples of your previous writing work along with whatever you think qualifies you for this role. If you do not hear from us within a week, please consider your application not accepted.

Feel free to reach out to me directly via the email address you can find at the bottom of https://growthsupply.com/about

Submissions section:

Submit your Medium story to The Startup in two easy steps:

1. Please fill out the form below:

2. And have a peek at our guidelines:

Topics we’re interested in

  • The future of technology and blockchain: Artificial Intelligence, cryptocurrencies, ICO, ethereum, VR/AR/MR, IoT, robotics, data science, machine learning, big data.
  • Web development and design: UX, UI, design, developing, programming, apps, software, hardware, SaaS.
  • Startup culture: Investing, entrepreneurship, VC, fundraising, angel investors, innovation, marketing, social media, leadership and management.

What to avoid

  • Stock photography: instead of using cheap stock images, try giving your story some love by picking a beautiful, free picture from Unsplash.
  • Listicles and clickbait headlines: e.g “These 5 things will make you insanely successful”.
  • Already-published stories: Medium’s algorithm favours ‘fresh’ stories. This means it will list articles by the date they were originally published — not in the order we accept them. In the interest of getting your story as much visibility as possible, please submit unpublished drafts only :)

**We reserve the right to edit photographs and copy where necessary**

Thank you in advance!

Ali

  • Ali Mese

    Medium member since Sep 2017

    Helping startup clients grow through storytelling at https://growthsupply.com

  • The Startup

    Medium's largest publication for makers, followed by +445K people. Follow to join our community.

    • Responses

    The Startup
